intro: Azara lechleriana, commonly known as the yellow azara, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes well-known plants like cinnamon and avocado. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Azara lechleriana is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, where it plays a role in the local ecosystem.
